title: Company first, employees last.
text: Promotions are available not to those who qualify but ti those amazon has in mind prior to announcing available positions. Transfers are impossible, as Amazon priorities your role in the company over your needs. Despite implementing health guidelines, staff refuse to follow these rules and as a result, more and more people are getting sick. Management and staff constantly change due to various reasons. The only good thing I could say about working here is that my checks cleared.

title: Great waiting job for the next best thing
text: If you’re desperate for a job and that pays well then Amazon it is. It’s great for temporary work. I personally don’t suggest for anyone else to work there if they have other offers but if it’s the only option then go for it. Pays well. It’s physically stressful but you have to pull through for that money. I feel as if everyone is overworked but that’s just me. Oh and every week there were at least 3-5 confirmed COVID cases within the warehouse. Be cautious! Stay safe!

title: Mismanaged company
text: The building I'm in is very mismanaged and management doesn't even know or care who you are. There is no since of safety, people not held responsible for their actions. They do not follow the standard work procedures at all.

title: Good pay but stressful and tiring work
text: The pay was good but the job was long hours of walking you get small breaks which don’t help your feet and the other employees look half dead if it wasn’t for the pay and easy dress code I wouldn’t have liked it

title: Have to get use to it.
text: If you’re not use to standing for a long period of time, then you’re going to struggle a little bit, the management show favoritism, and its so sad. 6/10

title: It’s not for everyone but I felt fairly compensated for my efforts.
text: It can be a very fast paced and physically demanding job. There is a lot of running around and general movement involved so be prepared for that. Management almost always had a very positive attitude, although it can often be hard to find a superior for questions or support when on the job. It was also discouraging to often see other associates slacking or just not working as hard as everyone else. I often saw associates having full on conversations in the middle of everyone else and these associates would often go unnoticed or without any disciplinary actions taken against them by management.

title: Favoritism.
text: •The staff in this facility, since they have been working here longer, they really only associate with people that been working there the same amount of time or more.  •Management don't really care what is going on as long as you are doing your job, other than that, they will only talk to you if you're not reaching goal during the shift.  •The breaks aren't long enough. I am a stower. They at times put on the very far side of the building, when it's break time, takes about 3 minutes to walk to the closest break room, but if its full, have to walk another 3 mins to another closest break room. Waste of 6 minutes of walking, only get 18 minute break then head back 6 minutes back to get in the station on time.

title: Fast paced
text: Great company, but hard to climb up as a tier 1. I was stuck in that position for almost 4 years despite having the experience and qualifications. Overall amazon is a great company.

title: good place to work
text: i worked in the warehouse and had a very good time. the team was amazing and everyone helped eachother out whenever they have the free time. i would recommend working here to anyone

title: Alot of opportunity
text: Benefits on first day, working hard for good starting pay. It felt like school. Diverse environment. Political corporation uses influence to effect its workers. Face recognition upon entry each day. Security alarms going off constantly upon entering and leaving. Does voice recognition to cancel 401 automatic enrollment.Mandatory overtime.

title: Not good
text: A LOT A LOT OF PHYSICAL LABOR. Pay is good but it’s up to you if you think it’s worth it, I personally don’t. You’ll end up loosing much more, my physical and mental state deteriorated. Very unhappy with this job

title: Good Health Care
text: My schedule is 11 hours then I am force to stay another hour for a debriefing session that I don't have a clue how to do.  I go home to get a call from Chime for a conference call from the Site Lead then another conference call on Work Life Harmony from headquarters.  This place is a joke.  No balance whatsoever.

title: It is okay.
text: I loved my job but they suddenly switched me to a different department which I hated and didn’t have a choice in.  The work from home opportunity is nice and the pay was decent.  The support was lacking.

title: Great Job And Great Benefits BUT...
text: This job has great benefits and the job is easy to do, BUT.. there is no music allowed and your isolated in a warehouse for 10+ hours every night. All there is to do is think about life and stuff. Really depressing. I really wish they would allow you to either work with other people, or listen to music or audio book.

title: Great company
text: I worked night shift at delivery station and felt like I was getting paid to workout, it was awesome. Culture was amazing and the team was great. Team effort makes the dream work

title: Warehouse work
text: Work was hard and had to keep up with the required rate count.  Seemed to be partial to young people or larger and muscular type people.  Training was okay.

title: Great
text: Great job great career. The management can be alittle off but the pay is great. Started working out of college and got accepted in a timely manner. Great

title: Okay workplace for when you get out of college
text: Amazon is a good place to work for right when you get out of college and do not have many outside commitments.  Be prepared for 10-11 hour days and working hard.  Pay is ok.

title: Easy job, great pay, hire anybody
text: No experience necessary, will hire anybody, easy job, great pay, great benefits, time off. I’ve watched a lot of people that I started with, grow with the company.

title: Unrealistic Goals
text: Long hours for physical work. Unrealistic goals set that are impossible to meet...even in a perfect world people can not do what they are demanding. I have worked at two different Amazons in the Pittsburgh area. One had the most awful HR Department. They never replied to your emails. And they were only on site for a short period of time after each shift. So you had to stand in a long line to speak with them. Your questions would not be answered, or answered incorrectly. The other Amazon is so huge it takes 5 minutes just to walk to the break room, bathrooms and time clocks. And the work is painfully physical for long hours repeatedly lifting heavy items. You are given shoddy equipment and not enough supplies to do an adequate job, yet they time you. Management can not handle stress when it gets busy. Training is inadequate. You are told different things by different people. Lots of covid cases abound.
